column8: Same situation like Malaysia now, bijan like Marcos many ppl dun like him as nepotism and cronyism spread. However, during Marcos Ferdinand reign, GDP growth has been rising steady until 1984 global economic crisis, where Filipino put all blame on their dictators. But after Marcos exile, the economy were in downward trend during 90s after failed management of few presidents, until Aquino beningo and duterte era economy only coming back.Bijan maybe corrupted, but still consider above average to make country grows. I not sure whether PH collations are able to do that or make us another Philippines PH again.
i only know one jiken rice now costs RM8 at least per platewhile 12 years ago only RM3
at least Pinoys every 5 yrs can change gomen, kick out bad presidents... here pimai pimai tang tu pekembar jer
D root cause is when d Chinese start leaving d cuntry. ASEAN monkeys can't run a roadside stall, let alone a country!
